column4: I am trying to change the permissions of a folder on a separate partition, but the konsole won't let me do it
when I run this command, I get this output:
chown: changing ownership of `/home/grant/docs': Operation not permitted
sudo su didn't even work for it
so then why can't I modify it?
that won't help, it's not ntfs
can't own/mod non-*nix filesystems   there is no permissions/ownership bits.
man moune has all the details.   i'll give you the short form.    use psyudo ownership/permissions on the entire fs with mount options.    sudo mount -o remount,umask=000 /mount/point
can't own/mod non-*nix filesystems,   man mount     man fstab     use umask= fmask= dmask=  options.
